title: Why does the A string visibly vibrate differently than the other strings on all of my guitars? - Quora

response.answer_text: The lighting you’re looking at it under. Fluorescent bulbs flicker at 60 Hertz, that string is vibrating around 110. When I put my harp between me and the CRT in my old TV, certain strings would nearly stop, visually. The rest would vibrate normally. Those strings would be vibrating near the CRT’s refresh rate, or multiples of it.
Fluorescent lighting flickering in response to a 50 or 60Hz supply and a string vibrating at 440Hz 440 / 8 = 55 (right in between 50 and 60) So perhaps it’s a stroboscopic effect.
